bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from J. L. Farnum to Laura Armistead Carter, July 7, 1928

div1.p: Farnum sends Carter a library card that will permit her to take certain books out of the Library of Congress for her research.

div1.head: Letter from J. L. Farnum to Laura Armistead Carter, July 7, 1928
div1.opener:
Book
file
Permission to
draw book
until Dec 31/28
LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
WASHINGTON
✓ F-B
OFFICE OF THE LIBRARIAN
July 7 1928
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
In response to your recent request, I am
sending herewith, by direction of the Librarian, a
card permitting you to draw from the Library books
on history, exploration and medicine, so far as they
may be spared from statutory and reference use, until
December 31, 1928.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, J. L. Farnum Secretary
(1 enclosure)
Miss Laura A. Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street N.W.
Washington D. C.
